replies.body: Try looking through memory expresses catalog

I can't really recommend too much since I haven't' personally dealt with them too much, but I can at least help you along the way!

When you're looking for a wifi adaptor, first and foremost you're going to want to make sure which one you get will be able to support the bandwidth that your router is using. For instance, I don't think you'd want to use an IEEE adaptor if your router uses mainly AC.

Again, I myself am not *super* knowledgeable about wifi adapters, but if you gather the information about your router then any salesman at your preferred electronics store should be able to guide you in the right direction!
